Name: drying of feed grain | drying of feed grain | EN15804GD, U
Category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0163:Post-harvest crop activities
Description: Drying at farm, in silo, at ambiant air temperature of grains for animal feed (barley, oat wheat, canola and soybeans). Silo average capacity is 240 tonnes.;This technology is used when grains can be harvest at low moisture content (e.g. about 18%), hence avoiding the need of hot air drying. Ambiant air drying in silo lasts 15 days. Afterwards, grains are stored in a ventilated silo for 4 days. Dust and particulate emission to air are not considered.  ;References : ;BEAUREGARD, G. (2013). Production budget of agricultural productions in Quebec. Technical report for CIRAIG.;CRAAQ (2010). Séchage des grains - Données techniques. AGDEX 736, juin 2010, 6p. [Centre de Référence en Agriculture et Agroalimentaire du Québec]
